CONSTRUCTOR

Method Detail

startPuzzleCreation

public void startPuzzleCreation()
STARTPUZZLECREATION will get the start and bumper list from the model, allow drawing. This should be called before this panel is made visibel so that the board appears ready for puzzle creation from the start.

getPressed

public void getPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent event)
GETPRESSED gets the key pressed event that does not correspond to a letter. Such as, Enter. Preconditions: The board must be ready to use before use. Postconditions: The pressed button will be registered in the model.

paintComponent

protected void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics gfx)
To draw current state of board.

paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()

Overrides:
getPreferredSize in class javax.swing.JComponent

drawBumpers

public void drawBumpers(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
DRAWBUMPERS will draw all the bumpers that exists in the model; on the board. Preconditions: StartPuzzleCreation() should be called first, or bumpers may not have been inputted at time of call. Postconditions: Bumpers that are in the model will be properly drawn on the Panel.

pos2Pt

public java.awt.geom.Point2D pos2Pt(Position aPos)
POS2PT changes the positions that we get into Points, containing X,Y coordinates. This is done because Points are usually reference X,Y; while Positions on the board are referenced Row(Y), Col(X). So things need to be translated.

pos2Pt

public java.awt.geom.Point2D pos2Pt(int aRow,
                                    int aCol)
POS2PT changes the positions that we get into Points, containing X,Y coordinates. This is done because Points are usually reference X,Y; while Positions on the board are referenced Row(Y), Col(X). So things need to be translated.

updateRegion

public void updateRegion()
Specified by:
updateRegion in interface RegionObserver

visualRegionUpdate

public void visualRegionUpdate()
REPAINTOLDREGION

clearRegion

public void clearRegion(ActiveRegion aRegion)
CLEARREGION will clear a region by redrawing it without the colors indicating that it is an ActiveRegion. Should be used when the user's actions cause the current Region to no longer be the Active Region. Preconditions: NA Postconditions: The region that formally was the Active Region will no longer be indicated to be so. The coloring that indicates the region is active will no longer be present.

Parameters:
aRegion - The region to be cleared.

drawRegion

public void drawRegion(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
DRAWREGION will draw a region by redrawing it with the colors indicating that it is an ActiveRegion. Should be used when the user's actions cause the current Region to be created. Preconditions: Board must be set up before use. Meaning all relevant data for presentation is available. Postconditions: The region that Current exists in will be colored as the active region.

Parameters:
aRegion - The region to be drawn.

updateCurrent

Specified by:
